docs.snippet: BARCELONA, Spain, Aug 10. -- The new Catalan Government, from which the Socialists are excluded and which took office when its Left coalition predecessor fell Thursday after a six-day tenure, has assumed all the power of a sovereign State.
docs.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Spain, Aug 10. -- The new Catalan Government, from which the Socialists are excluded and which took office when its Left coalition predecessor fell Thursday after a six-day tenure, has assumed all the power of a sovereign State.

headline.main: CATALANS ASSUME SOVEREIGN POWERS; New Government, Under Cover of Anti-Fascist Movement, Attains Nationalist Dream. GOES BEYOND AUTONOMY But Operates Under Shadow of Proletarian Groups -- Goded Still Held on Prison Ship.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Trading in bonds on the New York Stock Exchange reflected yesterday a continuance of the usual midsummer week-end influence. While the market was not without a few individual features, trading was routine in character as prices among the pivotal...
docs.lead_paragraph: Trading in bonds on the New York Stock Exchange reflected yesterday a continuance of the usual midsummer week-end influence. While the market was not without a few individual features, trading was routine in character as prices among the pivotal issues fluctuated within relatively narrow limits.

headline.main: TRADING IS ROUTINE IN BOND MARKET; Federal Issues Are Mixed in Tone, With Several New High Marks Set Again. TOTAL SALES $9,731,000 Midsummer Influence Is Continued as Many Dealers Are Absent From Desks.

docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 10. -- The news announcing the ruling out of Peru's 4-2 victory over Austria in Olympic soccer by the International Football Federation in Berlin caused indignant crowds to assemble here as well as in Port Callao today to protest the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 10. -- The news announcing the ruling out of Peru's 4-2 victory over Austria in Olympic soccer by the International Football Federation in Berlin caused indignant crowds to assemble here as well as in Port Callao today to protest the decision.
docs.abstract: Lima, Peru, consulate stoned, when Peruvian Olympic team is ruled out of victory

headline.main: LIMA MOB STONES GERMAN CONSULATE; City in Turmoil When Peru's Soccer Team Quits Olympics, Refusing to Replay Game. THOUSANDS JAM STREETS Police Disperse the Paraders -- Cancellation of Victory at Berlin Starts Trouble. LIMA MOB STONES GERMAN CONSULATE

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Dick Degener, Detroit; Marshall Wayne, Miami, and Al Greene, Chicago, finishing in that order, gave United States sweep in springboard diving championship, duplicating the blanket triumph in 1932 Olympics. Japan's quartet, Yusa, Sugiura, Taguchi and...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dick Degener, Detroit; Marshall Wayne, Miami, and Al Greene, Chicago, finishing in that order, gave United States sweep in springboard diving championship, duplicating the blanket triumph in 1932 Olympics. Japan's quartet, Yusa, Sugiura, Taguchi and Arai, set new world record of 8:51.5, winning 800-meter men's relay championship and beating United States four by 20 meters.
docs.abstract: D Degener (U S) wins men's springboard diving; Japan wins 800-meter relay, setting world and Olympic records; H Maenata (Japan) wins women's 200-meter breast stroke, setting Olympic record; S Uto (Japan) equals Olympic record in 400-meter free style trial; D Senff (Netherlands) sets Olympic record in women's 100-meter back stroke trial

docs.snippet: BARCELONA, Spain, Aug. 11. -- A military court composed of colonels, lieutenant colonels and majors sat on the prison ship Uruguay today and condemned to death General Manuel Goded and General Alvaro Fernandez Burriel, who were accused of military...
docs.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Spain, Aug. 11. -- A military court composed of colonels, lieutenant colonels and majors sat on the prison ship Uruguay today and condemned to death General Manuel Goded and General Alvaro Fernandez Burriel, who were accused of military rebellion. It is understood that they will be executed tomorrow morning.
docs.abstract: condemned to death by mil ct

headline.main: TWO REBEL CHIEFS CONDEMNED TO DIE; Generals Goded and Burriel Are Sentenced by Military Court on Ship Off Barcelona.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Aug. 11. -- Three American boxers won and one lost and was eliminated today in Olympic competition.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Aug. 11. -- Three American boxers won and one lost and was eliminated today in Olympic competition.

headline.main: Wilson, Kara and Scrivani Gain In Boxing, but Rutecki Is Beaten; String of American Victories Broken Only by Welterweight's Loss to Hungarian -- Judges Correct Mistaken Announcement After Crowd Jeers -- Chinese, Knocked Out, Wins.

docs.snippet: BARCELONA, Spain, Aug. 12. -- General Manuel Goded and General Alvaro Fernandez Burriel paid the penalty for treason when, at 6:20 A.M. today, they were executed by a firing squad in the historic fortress of Montjuich, the scene of innumerable...
docs.lead_paragraph: BARCELONA, Spain, Aug. 12. -- General Manuel Goded and General Alvaro Fernandez Burriel paid the penalty for treason when, at 6:20 A.M. today, they were executed by a firing squad in the historic fortress of Montjuich, the scene of innumerable military executions.

headline.main: 2 REBEL GENERALS SHOT AT BARCELONA; Goded and Burriel Executed by a Firing Squad in the Fortress of Montjuich. BOTH REBEL CHIEFS CALM Precautions Taken in the City to Prevent Disturbances by the Leaders' Sympathizers.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Aug. 12. -- Holding their opponents to three points in the second half after a hard battle in the first, the American basketball team today conquered the Philippines, 58 -- 23, in the quarter-final round of the Olympic tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Aug. 12. -- Holding their opponents to three points in the second half after a hard battle in the first, the American basketball team today conquered the Philippines, 58 -- 23, in the quarter-final round of the Olympic tournament.

headline.main: U.S. FIVE CRUSHES PHILIPPINES, 56-23; Holds Losers to 3 Points in Second Half -- Fortenberry Makes 21 Markers. AMERICAN RULES ADOPTED International Federation Votes New Code for Olympics -- Center Tap Curbed.

docs.snippet: Jack Medica lowered Olympic record to 4:44.5 in winning men's 400-meter free-style title, with Ralph Flanagan fourth. Miss Marjorie Gestring led American sweep in women's springboard diving finals as Miss Katherine Rawls and Mrs. Dorothy Poynton Hill...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jack Medica lowered Olympic record to 4:44.5 in winning men's 400-meter free-style title, with Ralph Flanagan fourth. Miss Marjorie Gestring led American sweep in women's springboard diving finals as Miss Katherine Rawls and Mrs. Dorothy Poynton Hill placed second and third, respectively.
